campgrounds.name: Canim Lake Resort
campgrounds.address: 4454 Newall Rd Canim Lake, BC V0K 1J0
campgrounds.description: Nestled between the Rocky Mountains and the Coast Mounains, Canim Lake Resort rests on the shores of a 24 mile long lake with mountains and rolling hills circling around. The whole family will love the endless activities offered at our resort. Choose from the several trails for a fun day of hiking, biking, cross-country skiing or snowmobiling. Join us in the summer and winter months! We have cozy log cabins that are fully-equipped to create a home away from home atmosphere. The cabins have fireplaces and electric heat to keep you warm during the colder months. If you’re choosing to camp, we have a large campground with RV sites and grassy tent sites to suit your needs. We have immaculate washrooms with free showers, full hookups with 30 amp service and laundry facility. Bring your camera as we have many wildlife living in our area. Catch sight of a bear, moose and other animals! During the summer months, take a swim in Canim Lake or relax under the sun on our sandy beach.
campgrounds.rates:
Seasonal Sites3Camping RatesServiced $50
Tenting $25 Add'l $5 Elec, Sewer, Water inc.Room Rates.

campgrounds.name: Canyon Creek Campground
campgrounds.address: 39035 Hwy 97 South Hixon, BC V0K 1S0
campgrounds.description: Beautiful scenery, eco trails, full hookups, pull thrus, secluded mossy tenting sites, shower house, laundry, store, barbeque, covered pavilion, fire pits, creekside settings, fishing, swimming, playground, volleyball, horseshoes, internet. Close to Hixon Falls, local attractions. All welcome. 10% Seniors discount on daily rates only. Weekly and monthly rates available. RESERVATIONS RECOMMENDED.
campgrounds.rates:

Monthly rates available

campgrounds.name: Canyon Hot Springs Resort
campgrounds.address: Hwy 1, 35 kms east of Revelstoke Revelstoke, BC V0E 2S0
campgrounds.description: Located in beautiful Albert Canyon, between Glacier and Mount Revelstoke National Parks, our resort is the ideal destination for family vacations. Relax in our hot mineral pools or discover pristine locations in the National Parks. We offer guests various accommodations, including our landscaped Campground and RV Park, rustic Cabins or luxurious chalets. With over 200 campsites, guests can choose among group, private or forest setting sites. Our sites are situated on lush lawns with fantastic views of the Canadian Rocky Mountains. Soak in the natural beauty as our campground sits along the Albert River and a mountain stream running through our resort. Our campground features shower, washroom, and laundry facilities, as well as sani-dump station, water station, convenience store, and natural spring drinking water. Camping isn’t your style? Stay in our beautiful cabins or chalets that features the comforts of home! We offer Honeymoon chalet, log cabins, family suites and pine suites. Our new honeymoon chalet is perfect for couples or families, and features a Jacuzzi tub and a two story layout. Our units are surrounded by the ancient cedar trees, creating a tranquil oasis.

campgrounds.name: Canyon RV Resort on Sinclair Creek
campgrounds.address: 5012 Sinclair Creek Road Radium Hot Springs, BC V0A 1M0
campgrounds.description: A well-known campground in a booming resort village. Located in private valley with a stream running through it. Spectacular washrooms, groomed lawns, mature trees. Close to hot springs and too much golf! A good home base for trips to Banff and Lake Louise. Reservations recommended. 7 days notice to avoid late cancellation fee of one nights charge..

campgrounds.name: Cariboo Bonanza Resort
campgrounds.address: 6384 Watson Road Lone Butte, BC V0K 1X3
campgrounds.description: Situated on beautiful Horse Lake in the centre of the Cariboo region, Cariboo Bonanza Resort is the ideal vacation destination for guests wanting a tranquil getaway. Unwind in the pristine wilderness and catch sight of majestic wildlife. Offering a range of accommodation, guests can choose from rustic to modern cabins, luxury chalet, bed and breakfast, or RV sites. All cabins are right on the lake and each has their own dock space. For a larger group, our chalet is perfect as it sleeps up to 8 guests with a large balcony overlooking Horse Lake. The campground is nestled amongst the gorgeous pine, spruce, fir and aspen trees, creating a true oasis. Showerhouse, washrooms and laundry facilities available for your convenience. Every site has a firepit and picnic table. Located in Canada’s best hunting region, discover deer, moose, black bear and more. We have boat rentals available, choose from aluminum boats, pontoon/party boats, paddle boats and canoes. Bring the kids along as they will enjoy our large playground, zipline, swings, waterslide, swimming and much more!

campgrounds.name: Cascade Cove RV Park
campgrounds.address: 1211 River Road Christina Lake, BC V0H 1E0
campgrounds.description: Junction of Highway 3 and US 395, on Kettle River, quiet, off highway, large pull throughs, grassy and treed sites, full hookups, 15, 30-50 amp power, tenting,showers, laundry facilities,playground, hiking, fishing, swimming, sandy beach, near golf course, pets. Large gazebo for family reunions. Trailer rental. Reservations maybe made by telephone, email or you may contact our Facebook page.

campgrounds.name: Cassiar Mountain RV Park
campgrounds.address: 1535 Barcalow Road Kitwanga, BC V0J 2A0
campgrounds.description: Cassiar Mountain RV and Campground has a True North Canadian vibe! This is a must-stop on the famous Cassiar Highway 37 to the Canadian Yukon and Wild Alaska. With 50+ sites, full services, located on 150 acres of pristine Canadian mountain wilderness, well worth the stop. Fishing, relaxing, camping, mountain biking, quadding, snowmobiling and of course the perfect place to master your roasted marshmallows! Everything you need at our a rustic and peaceful mountainside setting is waiting for you!
campgrounds.rates: Full Serviced Pull-Thrus; Serviced Back-ins $42 + tax Partial Service $35 (sewer/water); Unserviced $30 Tenting/Vehicles $25 Tenting/Bike $20 Add'l Adult $5.00 Child $5.00 2 per family

campgrounds.name: Castlegar Cabins, RV Park & Campground
campgrounds.address: 1725 Hwy #3 Castlegar, BC V1N 4W1
campgrounds.description: Situated halfway between Vancouver and Calgary, Castlegar Cabins, RV Park & Campground is an ideal destination for guests travelling on Hwy 3 or wanting a family vacation. Nestled on 23 acres of lush forest, our resort provides a peaceful mountain setting to unwind and relax. Our campground offers 42 grassy sites with full RV services, tenting and dry camping. We have a selection of shady and sunny sites, all with picnic tables. Luxury cabins that sleep up to six people are available for guests who don’t have RVs or tents. Stay connected with family and friends on our high speed WiFi. We have various amenities to guarantee a comfortable stay. Modern, washrooms and two separate laundry facilities are available for use. Join other guests at our community firepit for a cozy campfire or gaze at the starry sky. Enjoy friendly and warm hospitality from our staff, and tasty restaurants and fun entertainment located minutes away from our resort.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates $25 tenting - no services $42 3 people RV sites incl. elec, sewer, water for RVs Addl Adult $3 Child $3 Rooms with Kitchens 3 Room Rates $90.00 - $95.00

Children welcome.
Pets welcome but always on leash.

campgrounds.name: Cedar Falls Campground & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 7063 Tillicum Road Vernon, BC V1B 3N9
campgrounds.description: Tent or RV among beautiful cedar trees across from BX Falls and trails. Family-friendly. Located next to Vernon's city limits and enroute to Silver Star Mountain. Sites with firepits, seasonal store, laundromat with dishwashing area, washrooms with coin showers are all renovated. 30/50 amp. Serviced and unserviced sites, raised tent pad areas. Pet friendly. Free Wifi. Off season rates. Open year round by appointment.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesServiced $45-$55; Partial Service $40-$45; Unserviced/Tenting $35, per vehicle, 2 persons (2 Adults/4 Children) Addl Adult $10 Child Under 16

campgrounds.name: Cedar Springs Ranch
campgrounds.address: 230 Okotoks Drive Malahat, BC V0R 2L0
campgrounds.description: Nestled amongst towering cedar and fir trees, Cedar Springs Ranch offers a family-friendly destination. Situated in a forested mountain setting of Malahat Drive, our campground is an escape from urban life while still being only a 20 minute drive to Victoria. Explore the historic city, boat across the waters for whale watching or admire the beautiful flowers at Butchart Gardens. We offer various accommodations, including bunkhouses, tent sites and RV sites. Our log-built bunkhouses feature one or two bedrooms with log beds. Enjoy the sounds of nature on the swing on your own private porch. Some of the bunkhouses are tucked behind the trees and others are in open space. For your convenience, they are close to the bathrooms. The tent sites are nestled among the trees, while still near the main building and bathrooms. Camping with a big group? We offer a large and private area for tour groups. Our RV sites are either situated in full sun or beneath the large trees. There are full or partial hookups with 30 amp service, while others have 20 amp service.

campgrounds.name: Centennial Campground
campgrounds.address: 217 Third Ave New Denver, BC V0G 1S0
campgrounds.description: Centennial Campground, located along the shore of the pristine Slocan Lake and in the friendly walkable town of New Denver offers 43 sites available, reservations can be made online. Right next door is the Municipal Park which features a playground, playing field, beach volleyball court and a cordoned off beach for swimming.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates $25-$30 per night Electric / Water Yes

campgrounds.name: Cheekye Ranch
campgrounds.address: 60001 Squamish Valley Road Squamish, BC V0N1H0
campgrounds.description: Cheekye Ranch offers unparalleled views of the snow-capped peaks of the famous Tantalus Range nestled along the crystal-clear waters of the Cheakamus River, surrounded by the rugged beauty of the Tantalus Range Provincial Park. Cheekye Ranch offers boutique mountain style yurt and open camping with rustic charm. Indulge in outstanding mountain-inspired scenery and only 45 minutes from Vancouver.We are a working ranch and can only take emails at this time.

campgrounds.name: Chemainus River Campgrounds
campgrounds.address: 8682 Trans Canada Hwy Chemainus, BC V0R 1K4
campgrounds.description: 3 km south of Chemainus on Trans Canada Hwy. Enjoy our 9 wooded ha situated along the Chemainus River; featuring large sunny and wooded sites with water, power, sewer, showers, Laundromat and internet. Close to golf course and regional park. River swimming, badminton, horseshoe pitch; guest patio area. Pets on leash. Reservation fee and CP Policy. Tenting area closed in winter months. Monthly rates available.

campgrounds.name: Chilliwack Lake RV Rental
campgrounds.address: Chilliwack Lake and Cultus Lake Provincial Park Cultus Lake, BC
campgrounds.description: Enjoy the best of the RV Lifestyle! Avoid towing, parking, levelling, hooking up to services - we will have everything ready for you when you arrive. CHILLIWACK LAKE Experience a pristine valley-bottom lake surrounded by old-growth forest from the comfort of your 28 foot trailer located in Chilliwack Provincial Park. Nestled in the Chilliwack River Valley just two hours from Vancouver, you will feel like you are thousands of miles away. Spend the day canoeing or kayaking, swimming, playing with the kids at the sandy beach and playground, hiking, or just relaxing in the serenity of your campsite. Everything you will need to enjoy your outdoor adventure is supplied: electricity and water, barbeque, picnic and food preparation tables and fully-equipped kitchen. Amenities BBQ – Covered Patio – Parking -Playground- Boat Launch – Volleyball Court - Sandy Beach – Hiking – Firewood – Ice – Propane Campfire Rentals Rates Peak Season$145/night$761/week Low Season $125/night $661/Week Peak Season: All Weekends and Long Weekends 7 days a week June 20 – Sept 7 Trailers are available from May long weekend through to Thanksgiving.

campgrounds.name: Christina Lake Golf and RV
campgrounds.address: 230 2nd Ave Christina Lake, BC V0H 1E0
campgrounds.description: Home away from home in a perfectly located RV site, just minutes by golf cart to the first tee and Clubhouse. The location is very quiet, serene and majestic with the Kettle River and Monashee Mountains in the backdrop and the Trans Canada Trail just footsteps away.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Serviced $30

campgrounds.name: Christina Pines Campground
campgrounds.address: 1528 Neimi Road Christina Lake, BC V0H 1E0
campgrounds.description: Located in the beautiful Kootenay Valley, Christina Pines Campground is a family oriented campground for the family to enjoy their holidays. Take a dive in the warmest lake during the summer in Christina Lake, only a 15 minute walk from the park. Our RV sites are spacious to back in or pull through with fire pits at selected sites. Other amenities offered to create a comfortable and relaxed trip include a laundromat, washroom and shower facilities, outdoor heated swimming pool, mini golf and a snack bar. Spend a day hiking, biking or walking the scenic trails around the lake and campground. After a day of exploring, return to the campsite and enjoy an abundance of lawn games with the family. Share the memories created at Christina Pines Campground to family and friends via WiFi available throughout the park.

campgrounds.name: City Of Trail RV Park
campgrounds.address: 7500 Hwy 3B Trail, BC V1R 4E6
campgrounds.description: The City of Trail operates an RV Park in the city for the convenience of travellers to the area. The park offers various sites to choose from, including grassed grounds, partially serviced and gravel sites. For your convenience and comfort, washroom facilities and flush toilets are available for use. Stay connected with family and friends on our wireless internet. If you have kids, they will be enjoy our wonderful playground. We are conveniently located near many amenities if you’re needing to pick up a few supplies. Adjacent to Waneta Plaza mall, near Canadian Tire and Wal-Mart. Discover the beauty of the city and the many outdoor activities it has to offer. Relax and unwind under the sun along the banks of the Columbia River. There are many scenic hiking trails nearby for beginners to experts that offer fantastic views of rivers, lakes and mountains.

campgrounds.address: 1302 Voght Street Merritt, BC V1K 1B8
campgrounds.description: Large grassy sites, flowers galore, along Coldwater River. Gift shop with local art, crafts and snacks. Clean heated washrooms, free showers. Easy walk to downtown core with many amenities; shopping, restaurants, aquatic center, playgrounds, water park, museum, 9-hole golf course. We have golf discounts. Reservations required for winter months.

campgrounds.name: Clearwater Country Inn & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 485 Eden Road Clearwater, BC V0E 1N1
campgrounds.description: After a long day of travelling on Hwy 5, spend a well-deserved night’s sleep at Clearwater Country Inn & RV Park. Relax in our well-appointed guestrooms or our well-maintained campground. Whether you’re staying overnight or for a week-long, we are happy to exceed your expectations and needs. We offer different room types, including standard rooms and suites. Some kitchens are available if guests are wanting to fix their own meals. Our campground has the comforts of home for guests to relax and enjoy their stay. Coin operated laundry facilities and restrooms with hot showers available. We have large, spacious lots for any RV to drive through and park. During the hot sunny days take a swim in our pool or soak in the sun on our restaurant patio. There are many activities offered in the area, including horseback riding, whitewater rafting, golf courses, canoeing, hiking and more!

campgrounds.name: Clearwater/Wells Gray KOA
campgrounds.address: 373 Clearwater Valley Rd Clearwater, BC V0E 1N1
campgrounds.description: Situated in a beautiful parklike setting, Clearwater Valley Resort & KOA Campground invites your family to book their next vacation with us! Our resort and campground is ideal for guests to explore Wells Gray Park and its spectacular waterfalls, ancient volcanoes, various wildlife and glistening lakes. We are one of the newer accommodations in Clearwater and have recently updated our rooms. We offer a variety of accommodation, including Family Rooms, Upper Rooms, King Suites, and Bungalows. All of our motel rooms feature private bathrooms, air conditioning, cable TV and in-room coffee. Whether your stay is overnight or week-long, our friendly staff are happy to exceed all your expectations. For RVers and campers, stay in our treed park like campground under the night sky! We offer large RV sites, camp sites and rustic cabins. The campground amenities include picnic tables, fire pits, pull-through sites, electric and sewage hookups, flush toilets and hot showers. Guests have access to our seasonal restaurant, mini golf, heated outdoor pool, games room and much more!

campgrounds.description: Cool Waters RV park is located in a valley about 5 minutes south of beautiful Nelson BC. The RV park has select amenities, including wireless internet, electrical and water service.

Playground, laundromat, arcade, forest trails and sani-station for guests only. Pets welcome. Reservations recommended.

campgrounds.name: Coquihalla Campground
campgrounds.address: 800 Kawkawa Lake Road Hope, BC V0X 1L4
campgrounds.description: The Coquihalla Campground has approximately 117 camping sites and is located along the Coquihalla River. Approximately 32 are full service hook-ups with cable. The park has access to a variety of fishing opportunities in the area from fly fishing to river boat fishing tours. In addition, it is in a central location to some featured lakes and rivers in the area.

campgrounds.name: Cottonwood Bay Resort
campgrounds.address: 8183 Cottonwood Bay Road Bridge Lake, BC V0K 1E0
campgrounds.description: The resort offers motor boat, canoe, kayak and bicycle rentals. Bridge Lake is one of the nicest lakes in the Cariboo. It has over 20 islands, which you can explore. Bring your fishing gear and catch a lake trout, kokanee or rainbow. Enjoy the wildlife and maybe a fire in the evening.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Partial Service $32 (power/water) Tenting $25 Room Rates Small cabin $175 2 nights (minimum stay) Large cabin $242 3 nights (minimum stay); $286 4 nights; $320 5 nights; $34 for each add'l night Electric / Water Yes

campgrounds.name: Cottonwood Cove RV Resort
campgrounds.address: 2604 Squilax-Anglemont Road Lee Creek, BC V0E 1M4
campgrounds.description: Nestled in the North Shuswap region in the picturesque town of Lee Creek, Cottonwood stands out amongst its competitors. The resort boasts an onsite marina, outdoor pool and spa, private beachfront with over 1 km of premier Shuswap waterfront, convenience store, clubhouse & restaurant, watersport rental shop & ice cream shop, a designated dog beach, 2 playgrounds and internal walking trail system that leads to a Provincial Park. In addition to the vacation-style amenities, guests also have all the comforts of home with access to wireless internet, laundry services, shower facilities, and power, sewer, and potable municipal water hook-ups. As reservations become more difficult to get each season at Cottonwood Cove as more owners join the community, many campers of the resort who would typically rent on a nightly, weekly, or monthly basis choose to purchase their own lot and have a secure place to stay! Say goodbye to bookings and make family memories for life at Cottonwood Cove. Available lots start from $95,000 and range in size from 128m2 to 339m2. Purchasers have the option to upgrade their lot and personalize their space with a custom deck, fence, or storage shed. Members of the resort can have peace of mind knowing that the property boasts year-round security, maintenance, and long-term storage options during the shoulder season that runs from late October through to the end of April. RV Rentals are available through onsite management! Test out lakeside RV living - Try before you buy! To learn more about the resort visit cottonwoodcoveresort.ca.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates $55/night May/Jun/Sep/Oct $85/night Jul & Aug

campgrounds.address: 44280 Luckakuck Way Chilliwack, BC V2R 4A7

campgrounds.address: 2255 6700 Forest Service Rd. Horsefly, BC V0L 1L0
campgrounds.description: A beautiful, picturesque spot in the Cariboo Mountains of British Columbia, private and secluded. An off the grid, remote wilderness resort where our guests can escape the pace and encumbrances of modern day life, to enjoy seclusion, solitude and back-country recreation. We invite you to be our guests for a relaxing and/or exciting stay you'll remember.

campgrounds.name: Crystal Cove Beach Resort
campgrounds.address: 1165 Cedarwood Place Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0
campgrounds.description: Nestled among ancient cedars at the edge of the Pacific Ocean, this family oriented, pet friendly resort is located on Mackenzie Beach, just 5 minutes from the town of Tofino. From beachfront cabins with private hot tubs, to secluded cabins set in the rainforest, you will be immersed in the beauty that is Clayoquot Sound. For those who prefer to rough it in style, choose from sixty well treed, private RV sites only a short walk from the beach. Don't have your own RV? No problem, the Tofino Glamping Experience offers the feel of camping with all the comforts of a cabin. Inquire about our 10 parked Glamping 5th wheels. Named in 2018 by TripAdvisor as #2 on their list of the Top 25 Hotels for Families in Canada, Crystal Cove Beach Resort is sure to be ‘Your Happy Place’ in Tofino.

campgrounds.name: Descanso Bay Regional Park
campgrounds.address: 595 Taylor Bay Road Gabriola Island, BC V0R 1X3
campgrounds.description: Camp by the sea on scenic Gabriola Island. Two oyster bays provide many delights for kayakers, picnickers, campers, hikers and swimmers. Located near the ferry, the family-oriented campground offers private, wooded sites.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesLow Season $10/night (Oct - Mar); High Season $17/night (Apr - Sep) per vehicle, 8 people/max 4 adults

campgrounds.name: Dogwood Campgrounds of BC
campgrounds.address: 15151-112 Ave Surrey, BC V3R 6G8
campgrounds.description: From the East on Hwy 1 take exit 50, stay right follow signs. From the West on Hwy 1 take exit 48 follow 108 E Ave signs, turn off 108 E off of 152nd St. Pool, laundry, bus tours, pull- thrus. Arcade, playground. Free showers. Very accessible to Vancouver and it's attractions.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates$26.00-$50.00 per vehicle

campgrounds.name: Double "C" Ranch & Cariboo Country Inn
campgrounds.address: 6467 Birch Bay Road Horsefly Lake, BC V0L1L0
campgrounds.description: Our ranch is situated on the south-west end of Horsefly Lake with spectacular views of the Cariboo Mountains. Cariboo Country Inn & Double C Ranch offers a small selection of cozy cabins, campsites, hook-up sites, boat and kayak rentals. Our lakeshore, 1650 ac, working cattle ranch offers great opportunities to view local wildlife, birds & many different ranch animals. Treat yourself to fishing, boating, swimming, kayaking, hiking or a relaxing foot reflexology massage and much more. Weekly rates. Cariboo Country Inn is open from May to October with one winterized cabin available year round.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Serviced $35/$40/day Unserviced $30-$35/day Tenting $25 Addl Person $5 Day Use $20 Rooms with Kitchens 3

campgrounds.name: Driftwood By The Sea Inn and RV Resort
campgrounds.address: 170 South Island Hwy Campbell River, BC V9W 1A3
campgrounds.description:
Welcome to our outstanding Resort with wonderful ocean, wildlife and marine vessel views. Enjoy a memorable stay at Driftwood By the Sea Inn & RV Resort, where we make every effort to exceed your expectations. We take pride in providing genuine hospitality to all our Guests, many of whom are repeat Guests from all over the world!
Our well-appointed Ocean view One Bedroom Cottages are replete with personalized touches, and a kitchen prepped and ready for your culinary adventures. For our Cottage Guests; we provide free WiFi, Shaw Cable, the BBQ Cookhouse and free parking. Come relax with a Holiday Stay for 7 days or stay up to 4 weeks  - Check out our new Special Rates!! The charming Cottages are equipped with all new modern amenities and furnishings, for a most comfortable stay. For our RV Guests we provide Full-Service level, spacious sites, with either 30 or 50 amp service, City W/S as well as free WiFi . All of our guests are provided with access to our new laundry as well as our Washroom/Shower facilities that are second to none. ( * Washroom/ Shower use is Subject to COVID-19 restrictions as set out by the BC Govt).
Stroll along the waterfront to explore the amazing restaurants and quaint shops located downtown. Discover the rich history of the City at our Museum and Maritime Heritage Centre. Visit famous Strathcona Park and Elk Falls Park for exceptional wilderness adventures or chose an Adventure Tour to experience Whale and Bear Watching. All of these adventures are within minutes of our Resort. Warm yourself in the evening with a Beachfire with one of our Campfire Beach Buckets, walk the 8 km Sea Walk or take the picturesque trip by ferry to Quadra Island. At day's end, return back to the comfort of your Cottage or RV for a quiet, comfortable night’s sleep.
Book Today! We  look forward to seeing you soon!

campgrounds.name: Dutch Lake Resort & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 361 Ridge Drive Clearwater, BC V0E 1N2
campgrounds.description: Stay at the lake in Clearwater! This is the perfect location for a vacation or as part of your tour between Jasper and Vancouver. Guests have direct access to Dutch Lake from all nine private cabins. Each cabin is self-contained with kitchens and full bathrooms, including linens and towels. There is a firepit and picnic table outside each cabin for you to enjoy fix meals and campfires. Our campground offers various sites, including full service and partial service sites. For the convenience of all guests, we have excellent shower and flush toilet facilities available. As well, a coin-operated laundromat. All sites have a picnic table and firepit. Take a day off of cooking and join us at our onsite restaurant, Painted Turtle, for delicious meals. We have an open air covered patio to maximize the beautiful views. Fill your day with fun and adventure with many activities, including swimming in the lake or renting a canoe or kayak. Nearby are golf courses, trail rides and whitewater rafting.
campgrounds.rates:
Camping RatesServiced $47.62 Partial Service $44.76
Off Season rates availableRooms with Kitchens9Room RatesLow Season $139-$169 High Season $149-$189

campgrounds.name: Eagan Lake Resort
campgrounds.address: 8648 Eagan Lake Rd Bridge Lake, BC V0K 1E0
campgrounds.description: We are a family oriented resort located in a beautiful and quiet wilderness setting. The resort occupies 8 acres at the west end of Eagan Lake with nature trials through connecting crown land. The lake is 5 km long and 2 km wide, has an elevation of 3500 feet, it is noted for its Kokanee as well as rainbow trout up to six pounds. Numerous other lakes within a short distance offering a variety of challenging fishing. There are seven cozy family size log cabins. The cabins come complete with electricity, refrigerators, all required appliances, dishes, cutlery and cooking utensils. The campground has electricity, shower/laundry; playground, motorboats; and mountain biking. In winter enjoy cross country skiing, ice skating, snowmobiling, and ice fishing. Pets on leash. We are located near a Guest Ranch if you are interested in horseback riding. If you are looking for peace and relaxation, Eagan Lake Resort is the place for you.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates$30-$35Room Rates$60-$160

campgrounds.name: Eagle Wind RV Park
campgrounds.address: 26920 52nd Ave Aldergrove, BC V4W 1N6
campgrounds.description: Local to Fraser Valley and Metro Vancouver events. Easy access to Hwy 1, and just minutes from Aldergrove border crossing. Near Vancouver Zoo, Fort Langley, Abbotsford Airport, drive-in movies, casinos and local vineyard/farm tours. Come "Explore BC from Eagle Wind RV". Free local phone calls and WiFi/internet connection.
campgrounds.rates:
Camping Rates$44-$58
Weekly & Monthly rates available

campgrounds.name: Echo Lake Fishing Resort
campgrounds.address: 2126 Creighton Valley Rd Lumby, BC V0E 2G1
campgrounds.description: Located in serene Echo Lake Provincial Park with lush forests and a calm, glistening lake, Echo Lake Fishing Resort is a tranquil oasis from urban life. Relax and unwind in our rustic log cabins overlooking the beautiful lake. Our cabins range from various sizes to accommodate small to large groups. The cabins feature electricity, a fully-equipped kitchen, private outhouse and private deck. For our campers, we offer many sites that are nestled amongst the towering trees or on the shores of the water. The sites range from unserviced tenting sites to powered RV sites, suitable for all campers. All campsites feature their own picnic table and firepit. Some sites feature their own private dock or private beach. For the convenience of all guests, clean washroom facilities with flush toilets and hot pay showers are available for use. Experience the beautiful lake on one of our boat rentals, choose from power boats, row boats, canoes, kayaks and pedal boats! The kids will love our fun playground and swimming dock, perfect to meet new families and enjoy the clear waters.

campgrounds.name: Elkford Municipal Campground
campgrounds.address: 350 Hwy 43 Elkford, BC V0B 1H0
campgrounds.description: A riverfront campground located right in town and within walking and driving distance to all community amenities and indoor/outdoor recreational opportunities. Elkford is a place where nature prevails; experience breathtaking views, trails, wildlife viewing and more!
campgrounds.rates:

Add'l unit per site $10

campgrounds.name: Escott Bay Resort
campgrounds.address: 7097 Christiansen Road Anahim Lake, BC V0L 1C0
campgrounds.description: Our camping and RV sites offer water and power and sani-station. A small play area for kids is located on the back side of the front campground. A full range of accommodations include a chalet which features four bedrooms and is fully-serviced. Six other fully-serviced units range in size from smaller log cabins to larger two bedroom cottages.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesSites $28 per 2 person partyRoom Rates$100-$180

campgrounds.name: Evergreen Fishing Resort
campgrounds.address: 1820 Loon Lake Rd Loon Lake, BC V0K 1H1
campgrounds.description: Located on the southwest end of Loon Lake in the South Cariboo, Evergreen Fishing Resort provides guests with fantastic fishing and comfortable accommodations. Being one of the last naturally stocked lakes, Loon Lake offers quality rainbow trout throughout spring, summer and fall. Whether you choose to stay in our cozy log cabins or RV Park, we guarantee our guests a peaceful night’s sleep. Our spacious log cabins range from1-bedroom up to 3-bedroom. All of our cabins feature kitchen facilities, full bathrooms, private wharfs and large verandas with picturesque views of the lake. For campers and RVers, enjoy our large, level sites with partial or full hookup service. Pets are permitted in the RV park as long as they are kept on a leash. Central washrooms are available with coin showers. Each site has picnic tables and fire pits. Boat rentals are available for guests to use for fishing or relaxing on the water. We also offer canoes, kayaks and paddle boats. Spend a day hiking the scenic trails and catch sight of birds and wildlife.

campgrounds.name: Fair Harbour Marina & Campground
campgrounds.address: #1 Fair Harbour Forest Service Road Fair Harbour, BC V0P 2A0
campgrounds.description: Fair Harbour is the gateway to Kyuquot Sound. The area is renowned for kayaking, surfing, wildlife viewing, fishing and camping. Fair Harbour is the perfect place from which to stage your remote west coast adventure. Amenities include dry camping, cabins, general store, moorage and fuel dock, washrooms, showers, laundry, boat ramp.

campgrounds.name: Fairmont Hot Springs Resort
campgrounds.address: 5225 Fairmont Resort Road Fairmont Hot Springs, BC V0B 1L1
campgrounds.description: Experience Canada's largest mineral hot springs at this family-friendly BC Rockies Mountain resort. Enjoy 45 holes of golf, family ski area, spa, recreational programs, dining and 2 RV parks. Lodge guests enjoy exclusive access to guest hot springs complex.
